alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pulaski and southern Rockcastle Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 714 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodstock, or 15 miles north of Somerset, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Woodstock, Bee Lick, Bobtown and Dabney around 725 PM EDT. Bandy around 730 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Willailla, Quail, Ottowa, Valley Oak, Level Green, Bromo, Spiro, Maretburg, Hansford, Sand Springs, Wabp, Wellhope, Bloss, Pongo, Burr, Sand Hill, Luner, Pine Hill, Sinks, Withers and Donaro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central Kentucky.
